Welcome to assignment_2’s documentation!

Contents:

  • Module Reference

Project Overview

This package contains several ROS nodes and interfaces for controlling and monitoring a robot as it navigates to goals. Key components include:

  • ActionClient: Sends goals to a ROS action server, tracks velocity/position.

  • ServiceNode: Offers a service to retrieve the last sent goal.

API Reference

class action_client.ActionClient[source]

Bases: object

ROS Action Client for sending goals to a navigation server.

This client allows setting new goals, canceling current goals, and provides continuous feedback about the robot’s position and velocity.

client

Action client for the ‘/reaching_goal’ action.

Type:

SimpleActionClient

pub_position_vel

Publishes robot position and velocity in km/h.

Type:

Publisher

sub

Subscribes to odometry data.

Type:

Subscriber

goals_reached

Counter for reached goals.

Type:

int

goals_cancelled

Counter for cancelled goals.

Type:

int

cancel_goal()[source]

Cancels the currently active goal if it exists.

feedback_callback(feedback)[source]

Callback for receiving feedback during goal execution.

Parameters:

feedback (PlanningFeedback) – Feedback message from the action server.

get_input()[source]

Prompts the user to input goal coordinates.

Returns:

(x, y) coordinates as floats.

Return type:

tuple

goal_done_callback(state, result)[source]

Callback function triggered when a goal completes.

Parameters:

  • state (int) – Final state of the goal.

  • result – Result message (not used here).

goal_statistics_callback(request)[source]

Service callback to return statistics about reached and cancelled goals.

Parameters:

request (TriggerRequest) – Empty request.

Returns:

Contains success status and message.

Return type:

TriggerResponse

odom_callback(msg)[source]

Callback function for the /odom topic.

Publishes the robot’s current position and velocity in km/h.

Parameters:

msg (Odometry) – Message containing odometry data.

run()[source]

Main loop that listens for user input to send, cancel, or quit goals.

send_goal(x, y)[source]

Sends a new goal to the action server.

Parameters:

  • x (float) – X coordinate of the goal.

  • y (float) – Y coordinate of the goal.

class Last_target_service.ServiceNode[source]

Bases: object

A ROS node that provides a service to return the last goal sent to the robot.

This node subscribes to the /reaching_goal/goal topic to monitor the latest goal and exposes a service /get_last_goal to provide that information on request.

last_target

Stores the most recently received goal.

Type:

PlanningActionGoal

sub

Subscribes to the action goal topic.

Type:

rospy.Subscriber

service

Provides a service to return the last goal.

Type:

rospy.Service

goal_callback(msg)[source]

Callback function that stores the most recently received goal.

Parameters:

msg (PlanningActionGoal) – The message containing the new goal.

handle_last_goal_request(req)[source]

Service handler to return the last received goal.

Parameters:

req (LastTargetRequest) – The service request (empty).

Returns:

Contains the last goal as a PoseStamped, if available.

Return type:

LastTargetResponse
